chartbeat.title: NCAAM College Basketball Scores - NCAAM Scoreboard - ESPN

content.description: Real-time NCAAM College Basketball scores on ESPN
content.keywords: NCAAM Scores, NCAAM scoreboard, College Basketball Scores, College Basketball scoreboard

headlines.description: Kyle Guy scored 17 points, and No. 2 Virginia beat Wake Forest 59-49 on Sunday night for its 10th straight win.
headlines.shortLinkText: Guy, No. 2 Virginia pull away to beat Wake 59-49

video.headline: Virginia tops Wake Forest for 10th straight win

headlines.description: Moe Wagner scored 16 points and Duncan Robinson added 12 to lift No. 23 Michigan to a 62-47 victory over Rutgers on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: No. 23 Michigan rebounds with 62-47 win over Rutgers

headlines.description: Bruce Brown Jr. scored 19 points and No. 25 Miami shot 58 percent to hold off North Carolina State 86-81 on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: No. 25 Miami holds off NC State 86-81 for ACC road win

video.headline: Miami tops NC State to avoid 3-game skid

headlines.description: Deng Adel had all 18 points and 10 rebounds after halftime, including a late free throw that helped Louisville hold off Boston College 77-69 on Sunday for its fourth consecutive victory.
headlines.shortLinkText: Louisville leads big before surviving Boston College 77-69

headlines.description: Zavier Turner scored 20 points and had 10 assists and Manhattan defeated Saint Peter's 68-57 on Sunday.

Isaiah Reese scored 21 points but more importantly milked five critical seconds off the clock in the closing seconds and Canisius edged Iona 84-82 on Sunday in a showdown of Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference co-leaders.
headlines.shortLinkText: Reese helps Canisius get sweep of co-MAAC leader Iona, 84-82

headlines.description: Trae Bell-Haynes scored 17 points to reach a program milestone and Vermont won its ninth straight game with a 76-53 victory over Hartford on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Bell-Haynes reaches milestone, Vermont wins 9th straight

headlines.description: Iba Camara became New Hampshire's all-time rebounder, scored the final five points and blocked a last-second shot in a 53-51 victory over Stony Brook on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Camara sets rebounding mark, UNH tops Stony Brook 53-51

headlines.description: Travis Charles scored 21 points, David Nichols scored 17 while Alex Foster grabbed 13 rebounds and Albany dismantled UMBC 83-39 on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Albany spanks UMBC 83-39 behind 21 points from Charles

headlines.description: Matt Harris scored 24 points, Josh Gantz added 19 and UMass Lowell beat Binghamton 79-71 on Sunday for the River Hawks' first America East Conference win this season.
headlines.shortLinkText: UMass Lowell gets first America East win, edges Binghamton

headlines.description: Chaise Daniels scored 17 points, Rich Kelly 16 and Jacob Rigoni 15, and Quinnipiac shot 61 percent in beating Siena 76-69 on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Quinnipiac shoots 61 percent in 76-69 win over Siena

headlines.description: Chris Clemons scored 22 points and hit a 3-pointer with 0.3 left to give Campbell a 59-56 win over Big South leader Radford on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Clemons buzzer-beater gives Campbell 59-56 win over Radford

headlines.description: Kevin Vannatta and Ahmad Thomas scored 23 points apiece and UNC Asheville made 15 3-pointers in an 84-68 victory over Liberty on Sunday for its 13th straight win in the series.
headlines.shortLinkText: Vannatta, Thomas score 23, UNC Asheville makes 15 3s

headlines.description: Jahaad Proctor made five 3-pointers and scored 22 points to lead High Point to a 75-55 victory over Longwood on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Proctor scores 22 as High Point beats Longwood 75-55

headlines.description: Sean Lloyd Jr., scored 15 points with six rebounds and three steals and Kavion Pippen had a double-double and Southern Illinois beat Northern Iowa 64-53 on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: S. Illinois gets balanced scoring to beat N. Iowa 64-53

headlines.description: Clayton Custer scored 18 points with five assists and four steals and Loyola-Chicago pulled away from Valparaiso in the second half for a 70-54 win on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Loyola-Chicago peels away from Valpo for 70-54 win

headlines.description: Xavier Cooks scored 19 points and grabbed 11 rebounds, Josh Ferguson added 17 points and eight boards, and Winthrop beat Presbyterian 81-68 on Sunday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Cooks has 30th career double-double, Winthrop wins 81-68

headlines.description: Christian Keeling scored 26 points and Phlandrous Fleming Jr. scored 20 to help Charleston Southern beat Gardner-Webb 83-68 on Sunday to end its six-game losing streak.
headlines.shortLinkText: Charleston Southern runs away from Gardner-Webb 83-68

headlines.description: Tyler Rawson scored 22 points and knocked down a career-high six 3-pointers as Utah beat Washington State 82-69 on Sunday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Rawson scores 22, Utah rolls Washington State 82-69

nowFeed.headline: USC junior forward Bennie Boatwright will miss the rest of the season after suffering a left patella injury during Thursday's win, per the school. Was averaging 13.6 points and 6.4 rebounds.
nowFeed.story: USC junior forward Bennie Boatwright will miss the rest of the season after suffering a left patella injury during Thursday's win, per the school. Was averaging 13.6 points and 6.4 rebounds.

nowFeed.headline: Back at @KUHoops Brings back a great memory thanks to a great group of players. @LBSUhoops https://t.co/aMhklA2Vbl
nowFeed.story: Back at @KUHoops Brings back a great memory thanks to a great group of players. @LBSUhoops vimeo.com/256137612

nowFeed.headline: Under Sean Miller Deandre Ayton is maximizing his enormous potential. Ayton has always possessed the physical tools and a solid basketball IQ. He has worked hard at Zona along with making the adjustments to college basketball. For a freshman big man it's really hard to dominate right away. Since he arrived in the states he was a top ranked player in his class. Would have been top 5 in last years NBA draft. Now he will be a top 3 pick and will be much more prepared.
nowFeed.story: Under Sean Miller Deandre Ayton is maximizing his enormous potential. Ayton has always possessed the physical tools and a solid basketball IQ. He has worked hard at Zona along with making the adjustments to college basketball. For a freshman big man it's really hard to dominate right away. Since he arrived in the states he was a top ranked player in his class. Would have been top 5 in last years NBA draft. Now he will be a top 3 pick and will be much more prepared.

nowFeed.headline:
The race for the No. 1 seeds is more wide open now after a few recent upsets. Per BPI, here's where we stand:

Virginia 99%
Villanova 98%
Purdue 71%
Michigan State 52%
Xavier 32%
Duke 29%
North Carolina 9%
Tennessee 4%
Auburn 3%
Kansas 2%

nowFeed.headline: Houston coach Kelvin Sampson said "good teams should win at home," including his Cougars, who are 13-0 this season at home, including Thursday's 67-62 upset of No. 5 Cincinnati.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati shot just 6-for-19 (31.6%) in the second half vs. Houston, including a FG drought of nearly 12 minutes down the stretch. The Bearcats got out rebounded 36-27. Both of those bit them tonight.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati shot just 6-for-19 (31.6%) in the second half vs. Houston, including a FG drought of nearly 12 minutes down the stretch. The Bearcats got out rebounded 36-27. Both of those bit them tonight.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati's loss at Houston will likely drop them from the No. 2-seed line in Joe Lunardi's Bracketology, with Texas Tech likely being the beneficiary to move up. The Cougars, who were a 10-seed coming into the night, scored another big resume win after picking one up over Wichita State in January.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati's loss at Houston will likely drop them from the No. 2-seed line in Joe Lunardi's Bracketology, with Texas Tech likely being the beneficiary to move up. The Cougars, who were a 10-seed coming into the night, scored another big resume win after picking one up over Wichita State in January.

nowFeed.headline: Houston upsets No. 5 Cincinnati 67-62, ending the Bearcats nation-leading 16-game winning streak. It's the first time the Cougars have beaten two top-10 opponents in a season since 1984.
nowFeed.story: Houston upsets No. 5 Cincinnati 67-62, ending the Bearcats nation-leading 16-game winning streak. It's the first time the Cougars have beaten two top-10 opponents in a season since 1984.

nowFeed.headline: Ironically, Cincinnati's loss to Houston also finally gives Cincinnati its first win over a likely NCAA Tournament team.
nowFeed.story: Ironically, Cincinnati's loss to Houston also finally gives Cincinnati its first win over a likely NCAA Tournament team.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati getting it done at the foul line tonight, hitting 17-of-21 free throw attempts. The Bearcats are hanging on to a 50-49 lead over Houston with 4:10 left.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati getting it done at the foul line tonight, hitting 17-of-21 free throw attempts. The Bearcats are hanging on to a 50-49 lead over Houston with 4:10 left.
